[60]Turn it on and see.

[62]I don't think so. Sign here, please. 
[63]Date. 
[64]Oh, no. I meant that I need you to put the date by your signature. It's the 26th. 
[65]I don't think that'd be a very good idea. 
[66]No, it's my rule. I don't accept dates from men I've just met. I've only known you five minutes. 
[67]He touched my hand. And he came-on to me. That slimy, disgusting man came onto me and I had to pretend that I liked it. 
[68]You do know what this means... I've created our window of opportunity. 
[69]How wide is the hallway? 
[70]Jack Daniels, straight up. 
[71]We could rumble right up the front steps, bring the getaway car right to the vault, and then straight to Union Station. 
[72]Don't let their size fool you. These were rally cars back in the day. 135 mph, 155 horsepower -- 
[73]Let's put it this way: I can only get insurance through companies that advertise on TV at 3:00 in the morning. 
[74]You want the safe cracked, don't you? 
[75]Then I have to have perfect nails. 
[76]I just let you in on a valuable trade secret.

[78]Loud and clear.

[80]I know. I've got a date tonight. 
[81]You really make laugh. 
[82]Not tonight. I don't want to be out late. 
[83]Let's just say I've made some wrong calls in the past. I like to take things slow, cautious. Next time... 
[84]I trust everyone. It's the devil inside them that I don't trust. 
[85]What? 
[86]Who was that? 
[87]Ow. I don't remember. You're hurting me. 
[88]Let go of my wrist. What is wrong with you? It's just a saying. 
[89]Once the charter's in the air, he could change the flight path to anywhere. And good-bye gold.

[93]Did you have to be right?

dialogues.Handsome:
[1]What's that shit? 
[2]You wanna read something. Read between the lines. 
[3]Lemme see that book. 
[4]Yeah. 
[5]Can you chill out back there? You'd make a hummingbird nervous. 
[6]Shit. 
[7]How'd it go with the chick? 
[8]I don't want her on the crew, Charlie. 
[9]There has to be someone else. What about Bill Huchins? 
[10]Red O'Reilly? 
[11]Martin Hernandez? 
[12]I don't want a civilian to screw this up. 
[13]Exactly. She's emotional. You know what happens when emotion gets into it. 
[14]Try 'Deal A Meal'. 
[15]No problemo. 
[16]It's not the same as opening a safe for the cops. Your heart will be pounding in your ears. Perspiration on your fingertips. It's a whole different ball game. 
[17]Where's a grenade launcher when you need one? 
[18]Doesn't matter what time it is. It's either bad traffic, peak traffic, or slit-your-wrists traffic. 
[19]I'm sure it's ideal for carrying a ton of gold, genius. 
[20]If we had all green lights, fourteen minutes. But in the twenty times I've done it, the average is thirty- two minutes, with a top time of fifty minutes. 
[21]How do we get all green lights? 
[22]We still need an in to get the video blueprint. 
[23]Who plays cable technician? Steve thinks we're all dead. 
[24]Would you clam up. You'd give a woodpecker a headache. 
[25]Okay. You're the Napster. Heads up: cable chick. 
[26]And it's such a mystery why you don't have a girlfriend. 
[27]I have my doubts, but there's no talking to Charlie. 
[28]He knows better than to mix business with pleasure. Only I'm allowed to do that. 
[29]To get a work shirt and a service truck. 
[30]  
[31]Girls girls girls. 
[32] 
[33]Should we hang here? Check out the dancers? 
[34]No, but I take a whizz off the deck sometimes. 
[35]The guy makes Jabba the Hut look like a spokesman for the Subway Sandwiches' diet. 
[36]I'm trying not to. 
[37]He only answers to The Napster now. 
[38]We'll need three to hold the gold. 
[39]I'd say you're a Maserati 250 S. Just 4 cylinders but can go 0 to 60 in 4.2. 
[40]Never seen 'em before in my life. 
[41]Souped. 
[42]No. 
[43]Because you can't navigate your way out of a parking lot. Here's your ride. 
[44]He's not driving either. You ever got a speeding ticket? 
[45]You drive. I drive. Charlie drives. 
[46]  
[47]Got cha, boss. 
[48]Only place with worse smog and traffic than L.A. 
[49]Good news? 
[50]Meaning what the fuck? 
[51]Charlie. He could take a dozen different routes to the airport and we have no idea which one. We can't take out an armored truck during rush hour. 
[52]But where do we want it? We can't shoot it out with armed guards in a Brink's. We'd lose. And even if we pulled it off, the cops would be all over us, chasing us all the way to Union Station. We're outmanned and outgunned. 
[53]Everything's quiet here. Over. 
[54]Problemo. 
[55]He's brought in three identical armored trucks. 
[56]Three Brink's trucks are leaving with motorcycle escorts, plus Steve in his Ferrari. 
[57]    
[58]Yeah.
